item.description:
Prices include a two-night stay in a shared room or bunkhouse and all meals from Friday dinner through Sunday lunch. 

 * Listen to the call of the loons from this lakeside island retreat. *

Accessible only by water, it has 320 ft of lakefront, including a small private beach and swimming & boat docks. You can paddle your kayak among the many islands or there are hundreds of acres of wooded land and trails to explore.  Opportunities abound to fish, swim, hike, paddle, play horseshoes and croquet, or relax in the lakeside screened-in porch and outdoor decks and docks.  You can take a walk through the woods to a lovely stone chapel, or to the other side of the island for a view of the Ossippee & White Mountains.  The cottage also has two power boats, suitable for water skiing or simply cruising the lake.  We've even got a forest treasure hunt planned!

You just need to decide, from among the many options, what you'd like to do! 

Here, listen to the loons while you decide...

This Adirondack-style home easily accomodates a large group with its 4 bedrooms, bunkhouse, 2 baths, large, modern granite kitchen and two dining areas. It is located on Bear Island, Lake Winnipesaukee's largest island without bridge access.  All participants will be transported by boat or, if they choose, those who bring a kayak or canoe can paddle themselves to the island and their gear will be transported by boat.  It's only 700 feet from the mainland at Cattle Landing to the property.

The cottage faces directly west and has sun all day long with wide open views to the north and south. Enjoy the beautiful sunsets and the twice-daily passing of the Mt. Washington cruise ship. This cottage has it all.

Sumptuous and hearty meals will be provided which we'll all pitch in to prepare, beginning with Friday dinner @ 8:30 pm.

*Bring your own snacks and alcohol but all meals are included in the price!

Price includes two nights (Friday evening - Sunday afternoon) at this serene, private retreat, water skiing & boat rides, and  six meals from Friday dinner through Sunday lunch.  All for $185pp.

To Reserve:  RSVP here and pay by credit card or send a check to hold your spot.  Reservation not complete until payment in full is sent to: Larry Pilla - 21 Baker St. Dover, NH 03820

Do not wait to reserve.  There is a limit of 8 guests (in addition to the event hosts).

CLICK HERE FOR BEAUTIFUL PHOTOS & INFO!

Click here for MORE PHOTOS!

Click to hear the loons!

Sleeping arrangements:

King Bedroom  -  2 people

Queen Bedroom - 1 or 2 people

Double Bedroom - 1 person

Twin Bedroom  -  2 people

Twin Bunkhouse - 2 people 

Directions: Map software to "Cattle Landing, Meredith, NH."  Directions to mainland parking will be given closer to the date of the event.

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the Seacoast Outdoors organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgement.

As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. I have no special training and have not made this trip before.     - Larry Pilla
item.name: Winnipesaukee Island Weekend!
